channel.title: Full Stack Developer
channel.description: Good links to all parts of the stack, even though that's a ridiculously large area.
channel.contentWarning: !!!WARNING: Please basically ignore this pathway. This is an ad hoc development pathway that I've been using to quickly test this system. The links contained within work but many times the "curator context" is comedically incomplete or wrong.

item.title: A11Y Project
item.description:
Learn the fundamentals and principles behind accessible design

Context: Start here.

Step Objective: A broad but essential topic that should be considered in the early planning stages of any project and not treated as an afterthought. It takes more that passing some automated tests to have a good accessibility story. These resources will show you how.

item.title: Accessibility on Mozilla Developer Network (MDN)
item.description:
Accessibility (often abbreviated to A11y — as in, "a", then 11 characters, and then "y") in web development means enabling as many people as possible to use websites, even when those people's abilities are limited in some way. For many people, technology makes things easier. For people with disabilities, technology makes things possible. Accessibility means developing content to be as accessible as possible, no matter an individual's physical and cognitive abilities and how they access the web. The Web is fundamentally designed to work for all people, whatever their hardware, software, language, location, or ability. When the Web meets this goal, it is accessible to people with a diverse range of hearing, movement, sight, and cognitive ability. – (W3C - Accessibility)

Context: A wonderful resource that will take you far.

Step Objective: A broad but essential topic that should be considered in the early planning stages of any project and not treated as an afterthought. It takes more that passing some automated tests to have a good accessibility story. These resources will show you how.

item.title: Introduction to Web Accessibility | Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI) | W3C
item.description:
Accessibility resources free online from the international standards organization: W3C Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI).

Step Objective: A broad but essential topic that should be considered in the early planning stages of any project and not treated as an afterthought. It takes more that passing some automated tests to have a good accessibility story. These resources will show you how.

item.title: Diceware Passphrase Home
item.description:
This page offers a better way to create a strong, yet easy to remember, passphrase for use with encryption and security programs. Weak passwords and passphrases are one of the most common flaws in computer security. Take a few minutes and learn how to do it right. The information presented here can be used by anyone. No background in cryptography or mathematics is required. Just follow the simple steps below.

Context: Good tool.

Step Objective: Stay safe. Put security first.

item.title: List of Emojis HEX/HTML Codes - DEV Community
item.description:
Animal Emoji Animal Type Unicode Hex ... Tagged with webdev, emoji, hexcodes, html.

Step Objective: Stay safe. Put security first.

item.title: Privacy Decrypted #4: Understanding anonymity vs. privacy | Proton
item.description:
Anonymity is not the same thing as privacy, and confusing these two concepts can weaken your online security.

Step Objective: Stay safe. Put security first.

item.title: GitHub - bcgov/sso-keycloak
item.description:
Contribute to bcgov/sso-keycloak development by creating an account on GitHub.

Context: SSO DIY

Step Objective: Stuff for the backend from databases to ETL processes and basic OS stuff.

item.title: How to Set Up Nginx, MariaDB, and PHP with Docker Compose
item.description:
This guide shows you how to set up your LEMP (Nginx, MariaDB, PHP) stack easily and quickly using Docker Compose.

Step Objective: Stuff for the backend from databases to ETL processes and basic OS stuff.

item.title: Tutorial 0 - Get it RunningView
item.description:
Welcome to PostgREST! In this pre-tutorial we’re going to get things running so you can create your first simple API. PostgREST is a standalone web server which turns a PostgreSQL database into a RESTful API. It serves an API that is customized based on the structure of the underlying database.

Context: Testing merging.

Step Objective: Stuff for the backend from databases to ETL processes and basic OS stuff.

item.title: Understanding GitHub Actions - GitHub Docs
item.description:
Learn the basics of GitHub Actions, including core concepts and essential terminology.

Context: Should be in it's own step practivally.

Step Objective: Stuff for the backend from databases to ETL processes and basic OS stuff.

item.title: REST Client - Visual Studio Marketplace

Extension for Visual Studio Code - REST Client for Visual Studio Code

item.title: nginx
item.description:
nginx ("engine x") is an HTTP web server, reverse proxy, content cache, load balancer, TCP/UDP proxy server, and mail proxy server. Originally written by Igor Sysoev and distributed under the 2-clause BSD License. Enterprise distributions, commercial support and training are available from F5, Inc.

Step Objective: Stuff for the backend from databases to ETL processes and basic OS stuff.

item.title: Azure AI Search-Retrieval-Augmented Generation | Microsoft Azure
item.description:
Azure AI Search, formerly Azure Cognitive Search, is knowledge retrieval system GenAI applications powered byretrieval-augmented generation (RAG). Deliver the best AI experience to every user, at any scale.

Context: We may get to use this so know what it is.

Step Objective: Stuff for the backend from databases to ETL processes and basic OS stuff.

item.title: Mojibake - Wikipedia
item.description:
Mojibake (Japanese: 文字化け; IPA: [mod͡ʑibake], 'character transformation') is the garbled or gibberish text that is the result of text being decoded using an unintended character encoding.[1] The result is a systematic replacement of symbols with completely unrelated ones, often from a different writing system.

Context: When you need to know this, also know the phrase "binary bridge method."

Step Objective: Stuff for the backend from databases to ETL processes and basic OS stuff.

item.title: Flexbox Froggy - A game for learning CSS flexbox
item.description:
Welcome to Flexbox Froggy, a game where you help Froggy and friends by writing CSS code! Guide this frog to the lilypad on the right by using the justify-content property, which aligns items horizontally.

Context: Get good at understanding this and the world is your oyster.

Step Objective: All the client things. HTML, CSS, Javascript

item.title: </> htmx - high power tools for html
item.description:
htmx gives you access to AJAX, CSS Transitions, WebSockets and Server Sent Events directly in HTML, using attributes, so you can build modern user interfaces with the simplicity and power of hypertext htmx is small (~14k min.gz’d), dependency-free, extendable, IE11 compatible & has reduced code base sizes by 67% when compared with react

Context: Fun stuff.

Step Objective: All the client things. HTML, CSS, Javascript

item.title: systemfontstack
item.description:
Webfonts were great when most computers only had a handful of good fonts pre-installed. Thanks to font creation and buying by Apple, Microsoft, Google, and other folks, most computers have good—no, great—fonts installed, and they're a great option if you want to not load a separate font.

Context: BC Sans is cool and all...

Step Objective: All the client things. HTML, CSS, Javascript

item.title: A Beginner's Guide to HTML, CSS, and JavaScript | HackerNoon
item.description:
Unlock Your Web Development Potential with this Beginner's Guide to HTML, CSS, and JavaScript! Learn the Fundamentals and Create Stunning Websites.

Step Objective: All the client things. HTML, CSS, Javascript

item.title: Semantics - MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms | MDN
item.description:
In programming, Semantics refers to the meaning of a piece of code — for example "what effect does running that line of JavaScript have?", or "what purpose or role does that HTML element have" (rather than "what does it look like?".)

Context: Learn this stuff deeply. Knowing how to structure HTML well will serve you well.

Step Objective: All the client things. HTML, CSS, Javascript

item.description:

Context: Containers are not the sole purview of Docker. Much of our work revolves around Docker, but it is recommended that we learn something else too.
